## useOrInitialize() function

Uses a value or calls a supplied initializer if the supplied value is undefined.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function useOrInitialize<T>(value: T | undefined, initializer: () => Result<T>): Result<T>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

value


</td><td>

T \| undefined


</td><td>

the value


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

initializer


</td><td>

() =&gt; [Result](./ts-utils.result.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;


</td><td>

a function that initializes the value if it is undefined


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[Result](./ts-utils.result.md)<!-- -->&lt;T&gt;

`Success` with the value if it is defined, or the result of calling the initializer function.
